content.description:
Climb the face left of the Pine Sap tree (which is now just a rotten stump.) Don't use the left corner.

 This is #8 in Swartling/Mayer.
content.location: On the east face of the rock that is downhill and separate from the main wall.

content.description:
Well to the right of the rest of Hidden Buttress's climbs is a left-leaning sharp arete that leans even more left near top. Unlike A Cheval at Minor Mass, climbing astride this arete doesn't work so well. Climb it on the right side using holds on the arete and right of the arete. When the arete angles more left, abandon the arete and climb straight up the upper face to the top.

 When I first saw this rock I assumed it had been climbed before, but it is not documented in the Swartling/Mayer or Knower books. If anyone has any info about previous climbs or FA's, please comment. The vines and brush around the route were cleaned up when I climbed it in Mar., 2021.
content.protection: A couple good rocks on top for anchors.
content.location: On the extreme right end of the Hidden Buttress wall next to the talus field. From the main wall it's a little scramble to get there. The top, which is right beneath Squirm and Hive on Juniper Wall, can be accessed by going up the talus on the right of the buttress, and doubling back to the left.
Right corner of the piece of rock separate SW from main wall

content.description: It's a route!  Thin cracks to left of arete.
content.location: Crack just left of SE corner.

content.description: Climbs shallow groove/crack to were it ends,then straight up face, crux. Variation traverses right about 5ft into cracks before the final face, then up, aka 5.9 unknown (listed as Fern Man on MP).

Start with easy climbing up the lower rock face and the dihedral left of the sharp arete. When the dihedral runs out, look for a narrow horizontal crack with a couple finger-sized gaps that lead to a jug on the arete to the right. Traverse right to the jug, awkwardly mount the arete and follow it to the top.
content.protection: Rocks on top for the anchor.
content.location: On the extreme right end of the Hidden Buttress wall next to the talus field. From the main wall it's a little scramble to get there. The top, which is right beneath Squirm and Hive on Juniper Wall, can be accessed by going up the talus on the right of the buttress, and doubling back to the left.
Thin cracks in the center of Hidden Buttress to the left of "Peanuts".

content.description:
Climb up cracks under the left side of the overhang to a ledge. Step right and up above the overhang to finish on the upper part of Hidden Overhang.

 This is #11 in Swartling/Mayer.
content.location: On the left side of the south face of the rock that is downhill and separate from the main wall.

content.description:
Climb the face directly under the overhang. Climb the overhang (crux) and finish on easy climbing above.

 This is #10 in Swartling/Mayer.
content.location: On the left side of the south face of the rock that is downhill and separate from the main wall.
Face to ledge, then up the crack above. To the left of "Linus".

content.description:
Start up crack on left side of the wall, Nowhere Man.  At the ledge, step right and use an unlikely-looking series of sidepulls and crimps to get to the top. 

  The hands end up being better than they look from below, but there isn't much for the feet most of the way.
content.location: On the left side of Hidden Buttress

content.description: Up the crack of Nowhere Man to the ledge.  Then up out of the alcove and left across the ramp.
content.location: Crack up the left side of the wall

content.description: Ok warm up, mostly small ledge pulling.
content.protection: Nuts and a cam or two, not very well protected.
content.location: Right side of East corner on Hidden Buttress. Top out is over grown with plants in the summer.

content.description: Climb the face using small but plentiful holds. The entire description of this route in Swartling/Mayer (#9) is "Broken face".
content.location: On the right side of the south face of the rock that is downhill and separate from the main wall.

pathTokens: East Bluff 03 - West of the Quarry

content.description: Maybe even closer to the road than Stettner's Rocks.  A quiet location with a few great lines in the 5.8-5.11 range.  A great warm up on your way up to the hard stuff at White Wall.
